creditline: Gift of Daniel Greenberg and Susan Steinhauser
description: small flat base; rounded bottom; tall sides taper slightly inward; three arcing tapering relief elements extend upward from base; organic design; medium brown; glossy surface
marks:
Signature, Title, Date, Inscription and Sticker
 on bottom, incised: [#1042 / \"DALBERGIA / GRASS\" /
text:
Hunter carved Dalbergia Grass from a single piece of densely-grained cocobolo wood. He created a contemporary vase, with the same exuberance as the 18th-century Chelsea vase nearby, through his own skill, strength, and control first in turning, then in carving, a single piece of wood. The grasslike carvings complement the tall vertical form. It is one of a series of works Hunter developed that are named after the genus of the cocobolo tree, Dalbergia. 
.
title: Dalbergia Grass
